newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SOCCER-SLOVAKIA CONTINUE WINNING RUN IN WORLD CUP CAMPAIGN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SLOVAKIA CONTINUE WINNING RUN IN WORLD CUP CAMPAIGN.

text.p: Slovakia scored their third straight victory in a World Cup qualifier on Wednesday when they accounted for the Faroe Islands 3-0 in a European group six match.

Slovakia, in their first bid to qualify for the World Cup finals, led 2-0 at halftime thanks to goals by Peter Dubovsky and Tibor Jancula, followed in the second term by a 57th minute penalty to Julius Simon.

Wednesday's victory in front of 5,500 supporters leaves Slovakia in second place on nine points, behind group leaders Yugoslavia on goal-difference. In previous matches they have beaten the Faroe Islands 2-1 and Malta 6-0.

But they face a much stiffer test on November 13 when they travel to Spain. The Czech Republic are the sixth team in the group. Dubovsky opened the scoring in the 20th minute when he accepted a neat backpass from Jancula and hammered home from the middle of the penalty area.
In the 44th minute Simon passed to Jancula who netted Slovakia's second goal and Simon converted a penalty in the 57th minute after Jancula was brought down by Oli Johannesen.

Slovakia: 1-Alexander Vencel, 2-Marian Zeman, 3-Miroslav Karhan (14-Ivan Kozak, 84th), 4-Robert Tomaschek, 5-Vladimir Kinder, 6-Dusan Tittel, 7-Igor Balis (13-Jozef Kozlej, 68th), 8-Julius Simon, 9-Tibor Jancula, 10-Peter Dubovsky, 11-Jaroslav Timko (18-Marek Uljaky, 68th).

Faroe Islands: 1-Jens Martin Knudsen, 2-Oli Johannesen, 3-Henning Jarnskor, 4-Andreas Hansen, 5-Ossur Hansen, 6-Allan Morkore, 7-Julian Johnsson, 8-Jan Dam (13-Poul Ennigard, 63rd), 9-Jan Allan Mueller, 10-Todi Jonsson (14-Uni Arge, 46th), 11-John Petersen (17-Simun Eliasen, 35th).
